title: Ahmek

properties.name: description
properties.value: Ahmek was a ruthless warrior who lived during the Second Age. He crafted the Lightbearer, a powerful ring imbued with unstable energy left behind from Tumeken's sacrifice during the Kharidian–Zarosian War. Ahmek hoped to use this ring to forcibly unite the assorted bands of thieves and mercenaries under his command – and to overthrow Osmumten. Fate, however, had other plans. On the very night he created it, he was murdered in his sleep and the ring stolen. Soon after, this dreaded item was snatched from the body of a thief by some Menaphite Guards, who presented it to Osmumten.

content:
Not to be confused with Akhem.

Ahmek was a ruthless warrior who lived during the Second Age. He crafted the Lightbearer, a powerful ring imbued with unstable energy left behind from Tumeken's sacrifice during the Kharidian–Zarosian War. Ahmek hoped to use this ring to forcibly unite the assorted bands of thieves and mercenaries under his command – and to overthrow Osmumten. Fate, however, had other plans. On the very night he created it, he was murdered in his sleep and the ring stolen. Soon after, this dreaded item was snatched from the body of a thief by some Menaphite Guards, who presented it to Osmumten.
rawContent:
{{confuse|Akhem}}
'''Ahmek''' was a ruthless warrior who lived during the [[Second Age]]. He crafted the [[Lightbearer]], a powerful ring imbued with unstable energy left behind from [[Tumeken]]'s sacrifice during the [[Kharidian–Zarosian War]]. Ahmek hoped to use this ring to forcibly unite the assorted bands of thieves and mercenaries under his command – and to overthrow [[Osmumten]]. Fate, however, had other plans. On the very night he created it, he was murdered in his sleep and the ring stolen. Soon after, this dreaded item was snatched from the body of a thief by some Menaphite Guards, who presented it to Osmumten.

[[Category:Characters that do not appear in-game]]
[[Category:Characters from the Second Age]]
